channel.title: OSX on any Intel/AMD PC
channel.description:
http://osx86.thefreesuite.com/
Can't try this out yet... I have a shit computer, but I am definitely putting Mac OSX on a partition of my computer.
Requirements: At least 6 GB free HDD space. At least [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SSE2#CPUs_supporting_SSE2]SSE2[/url], [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SSE3#CPUs_with_SSE3]SSE3[/url] is recommended. At least 512MB of memory. DVD drive for install. XP + Partition software or just Vista [url=http://isohunt.com/download/27962280/leopard]Leopard install disk[/url] - no crack or anything needed... that's Apple's warez policy.

item.title: OSX on any Intel/AMD PC
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:10, topic:162235”]@error: yes it is

@xxlegitxx: the dvd is in .dmg format, which i dont know how to unpack…
would it be smart to install tiger first?[/quote]

http://vu1tur.eu.org/tools/ See if that works.

R.I.P RSC:

.dmg is for Mac OSX, I downloaded a game once in the same format. Came to the conclusion that it didnt work on xp

Amusing.

Read full topic

item.title: OSX on any Intel/AMD PC
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

xxlegitxx:

Leopard itself needs no serial key, I believe. Normally, just pop in the disk and upgrade it from Tiger, no questions asked. And the upgrading process is blazing fast also.

i dont have tiger installed…

Read full topic

item.title: OSX on any Intel/AMD PC
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:4, topic:162235”]i don’t know anyone with a leopard disk.
anyways, can you just update and do regular stuff on it, without needing something like a serial key?[/quote]

Leopard itself needs no serial key, I believe. Normally, just pop in the disk and upgrade it from Tiger, no questions asked. And the upgrading process is blazing fast also.

Read full topic

item.title: OSX on any Intel/AMD PC
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:3, topic:162235”][quote author=sppt link=topic=220650.msg1910981#msg1910981 date=1196651051]
does that leopard install disk work for ANY AMD64 bits pc, without having to modify it, or download a different version?
and i guess i’d need a dual-layer dvd, or can you put it on two disks?
[/quote]

I think the leopard install disks are pretty much universal. Seems like you would need dual-layer, not entirely sure how you could decide which stuff goes on which disk. I have a friend who has a Leopard DVD, so I’ll just borrow one from him. Maybe you could do the same?[/quote]
i don’t know anyone with a leopard disk.
anyways, can you just update and do regular stuff on it, without needing something like a serial key?

Read full topic

item.title: OSX on any Intel/AMD PC
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:2, topic:162235”]does that leopard install disk work for ANY AMD64 bits pc, without having to modify it, or download a different version?
and i guess i’d need a dual-layer dvd, or can you put it on two disks?[/quote]

I think the leopard install disks are pretty much universal. Seems like you would need dual-layer, not entirely sure how you could decide which stuff goes on which disk. I have a friend who has a Leopard DVD, so I’ll just borrow one from him. Maybe you could do the same?

Read full topic

http://osx86.thefreesuite.com/

Can’t try this out yet… I have a shit computer, but I am definitely putting Mac OSX on a partition of my computer.

Requirements:
At least 6 GB free HDD space.
At least SSE2, SSE3 is recommended.
At least 512MB of memory.
DVD drive for install.
XP + Partition software or just Vista
Leopard install disk - no crack or anything needed… that’s Apple’s warez policy.
